texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Although I use GNOME 3 as my desktop environment, I prefer KDE's  kwallet  service to gnome-keyring for some functions. The user interface is a little easier to use and it's easier to link up to the  keyring module  in Python.
texts.text: Although I use GNOME 3 as my desktop environment, I prefer KDE's  kwallet  service to gnome-keyring for some functions. The user interface is a little easier to use and it's easier to link up to the  keyring module  in Python.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: A few errant mouse clicks caused me to accidentally disable the kwalletd service earlier today and I was struggling to get it running again. The daemon is usually started by dbus and I wasn't entirely sure how to start it properly.
texts.text: A few errant mouse clicks caused me to accidentally disable the kwalletd service earlier today and I was struggling to get it running again. The daemon is usually started by dbus and I wasn't entirely sure how to start it properly.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: If I start kwalletmanager, I see the kwallet icon in the top bar. However, it's unresponsive to clicks. Starting kwalletmanager on the command line leads to lots of errors in the console:
texts.text: If I start kwalletmanager, I see the kwallet icon in the top bar. However, it's unresponsive to clicks. Starting kwalletmanager on the command line leads to lots of errors in the console:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
kwalletmanager(20406)/kdeui (Wallet): The kwalletd service has been disabled
kwalletmanager(20406)/kdeui (Wallet): The kwalletd service has been disabled
kwalletmanager(20406)/kdeui (Wallet): The kwalletd service has been disabled
texts.text:
kwalletmanager(20406)/kdeui (Wallet): The kwalletd service has been disabled
kwalletmanager(20406)/kdeui (Wallet): The kwalletd service has been disabled
kwalletmanager(20406)/kdeui (Wallet): The kwalletd service has been disabled

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Manually running kwalletd in the console wasn't successful either.
texts.text: Manually running kwalletd in the console wasn't successful either.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: KDE provides a utility called kcmshell that allows you to start a configuration panel without running the entire KDE environment. If you disable kwallet accidentally like I did, this will bring up the configuration panel and allow you to re-enable it:
texts.text: KDE provides a utility called kcmshell that allows you to start a configuration panel without running the entire KDE environment. If you disable kwallet accidentally like I did, this will bring up the configuration panel and allow you to re-enable it:

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: You should see kwallet's configuration panel appear:
texts.text: You should see kwallet's configuration panel appear:

texts.label: caption
texts.orig: KDE wallet control module for kwallet
texts.text: KDE wallet control module for kwallet

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Click on  Enable the KDE wallet subsystem  and then click OK. Once the window closes, start kwalletmanager and you should be able to access your secrets in kwallet again.
texts.text: Click on  Enable the KDE wallet subsystem  and then click OK. Once the window closes, start kwalletmanager and you should be able to access your secrets in kwallet again.
